Certainly! One example of a song that contains a deeper message that may be missed by the casual listener is "This is America" by Childish Gambino (also known as Donald Glover).

On the surface, the song may seem like a simple trap song with a catchy beat and repetitive chorus. However, upon closer examination of the lyrics and music video, it is clear that there is a much deeper message being conveyed.

For example, the line "This a celly / That's a tool" may seem like a reference to cell phones, but "celly" is also street slang for a prison cell, while "tool" is slang for a gun. This line is likely intended to draw attention to the issue of gun violence and mass incarceration in America.

Additionally, the music video contains numerous references to police brutality, America's history of racism and violence towards black people, and the commodification of black culture.  For example, the scene in which Childish Gambino shoots a group of gospel singers is likely a reference to the Charleston church shooting in 2015, which was perpetrated by a white supremacist.

Overall, "This is America" is a complex and multifaceted work of art that requires careful analysis to fully understand its message. It is an example of how contemporary music can be used to comment on important societal issues in a nuanced and thought-provoking way.
